n't make a virtual omelet without getting a few eggheads scrambled. This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an` anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports.`` Maybe it's irony, or maybe it's payback. To make everybody a little nervous, Simon Cowell says. By putting up that kind of prize money, it's a massive, massive risk. But it's also an incredible incentive, Simon Cowell told reporters Monday of the decision to offer the winning X Factor act a$ 5 million recording contract.`` I think it puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure. turned on to it,'' said NBA deputy commissioner Russ Granik , who was at Philadelphia's First Union Center on Wednesday night, when Allen Iverson scored 54 points to Vince Carter 's 28 in the 76ers' 97-92 victory. For better or worse, fans like it when you get superstars going against each other. People have been hearing about these guys for years now, but they haven't gotten this far before where they met each other at this level. That gets people interested. With the NBA's overall popularity declining and new rules designed to make the game more appealing set to take effect next season, an Iverson-Carter matchup is what the league really needed.`` Watching these two kids,

David Letterman then asks her what she does in her free time and Betty White says, Oh, I like to do most anything. Play with animals, mostly. And vodka's kind of a hobby. So David Letterman reaches down from behind the desk and produces a bottle of Grey Goose, to which Betty White laughs heartily. They share some vodka, then she does a classic spit-take.
